Codebook.definition: Perceptions and standards related to the overall quality of software development and output.
inclusion_criteria: Mentions of software quality as a general concept.
References to standards, assurance, or practices aimed at improving software.
exclusion_criteria: Focuses solely on specific practices without general context.
typical_examples: Software quality is a complex concept
Codebook.notes: This code encapsulates broad interpretations of quality without delving into distinct technical specifics.

Codebook.definition: Ensuring the software meets the outlined business objectives and requirements.
inclusion_criteria: Mentions of business objectives in relation to software development.
References to how well software satisfies client or stakeholder needs.
exclusion_criteria: Discussions of general quality without business focus.
Codebook.notes: This code is specifically concerned with alignment between software function and business goals.

Codebook.definition: Software being void of bugs, errors, or faults.
inclusion_criteria: Mentions of software being bug-free or error-free.
Reference to testing or assurance with the aim of eliminating defects.
exclusion_criteria: General quality discussions not mentioning defects.
Aesthetic or design-focused quality attributes not related to errors.
Codebook.notes: This code is often connected with iterative testing and QA processes to achieve bug-free results.

Codebook.definition: Ongoing efforts to enhance the software development process or product quality.
inclusion_criteria: Mentions of ongoing or iterative improvements.
References to processes like Scrum aimed at constant betterment.
exclusion_criteria: Static or final product discussions without iterative context.
Codebook.notes: This code is linked to Agile methodologies and a focus on refinement over time.

Codebook.definition: Use of Scrum agile process in enhancing quality and productivity in software development.
inclusion_criteria: Describing the impact or processes related to Scrum.
exclusion_criteria: Mentions of Scrum with no quality context.
Codebook.notes: Often cited alongside continuous improvement as part of Agile approaches.

Codebook.definition: Working together in teams or with stakeholders to achieve better software outcomes.
inclusion_criteria: Mentions of teamwork or collaborative effort.
References to shared goals or joint development processes.
Codebook.notes: Highlighted as an essential component in Agile and modern software development practices.
